required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Shrinking the Size of the Tobacco Power Wall and Restricting the Number of Tobacco Products Displayed to Reduce Adolescent Tobacco Use
clinical_study.official_title: Shrinking the Size of the Tobacco Power Wall and Restricting the Number of Tobacco Products Displayed to Reduce Adolescent Tobacco Use

brief_summary.textblock: The overall aim of this research is to experimentally evaluate the extent to which reducing the size of the tobacco power wall and the number of tobacco product units displayed influences tobacco use risk in adolescents.

primary_outcome.description: intentions to use tobacco, as assessed by a three item scales with type of tobacco product inserted in brackets: 1) Do you think you will try [tobacco product] soon?; 2) Do you think you will try [tobacco product] in the next year; & 3) If one of your best friends offered you [tobacco product] would you use it? Responses to each item are made on a 10-point scale where 1 = definitely not; and 10 = definitely yes.

arm_group.description: The tobacco power wall and number of products appears in a typical format: large power wall with a large number of products (defined here as three large cabinets)
The tobacco power wall and number of tobacco products appear in their smallest format: small power wall with a small number of products displayed (defined here as one large cabinet)

The tobacco power wall and number of tobacco products appear in a format sized between the control and small conditions: a medium sized power wall with a medium number of products displayed (defined here as two large cabinets).

intervention.intervention_name: Tobacco power wall size and tobacco products displayed
intervention.description: The intervention varies the size of the tobacco power wall and number of tobacco products displayed on it.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- between the ages of 11 and 20
Exclusion Criteria:
- any medical or psychological condition that would make participation in the procedures of the study difficult (based on self-report).
